title: Compliance levels
text: Different versions PDF/standard PDF/-1, -2, -3, -4 introduced different times. version adds removes features (e.g., attachments, layers, engineering data, new PDF 2.0 rules). single profile wouldn’t able reflect variations. Different strictness levels workflows need full accessibility semantic structure (-level). Others need document display correctly future (B-level). need reliable text extraction without full tagging (U-level). Different intended uses Archiving, accessibility, engineering content, file containers, content reuse require different rules. Profiles let software validate exactly scenario document created . Separate standards beyond PDF/PDF/UA (accessibility) WTPDF (web-friendly PDF standards) define requirements, get profiles.

title: Compliance levels

title: What is PDF accessibility?
text: PDF accessibility ensures everyone, including people disabilities, can access understand content PDF. goes beyond simply making document readable screen. requires structuring content assistive technologies, screen readers, magnifiers, voice navigation tools, can interpret accurately. properly tagged PDF includes logical headings, lists, tables, links reflect real structure document. Images charts alternative text describes purpose meaning. Text embedded images, users can select, search, copy . example, scanned document turned searchable text using OCR (Optical Character Recognition) accessible flat image. also conformance levels defined standards like PDF/UA-1 (ISO 14289-1), focuses universal accessibility, PDF/, ensures long-term preservation content. Within PDF/, levels (Accessible), B (Basic), U (Unicode) define well document preserves structure text accessibility. PDF/-1a PDF/-2a, instance, include tagged structure language specification meet accessibility goals, PDF/-1b guarantees visual reproducibility.

title: What is PDF accessibility?
text: Accessible PDFs matter make digital information usable everyone, just perfect vision motor control. student using screen reader can navigate accessible lecture handout headings, employee low vision can increase font size without losing context. documents also help organizations meet legal ethical responsibilities. Laws Americans Disabilities Act (ADA), Section 508 Rehabilitation Act US, Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) internationally emphasize importance equal access. broader perspective, accessible PDFs improve experience readers. Well-structured tagging makes documents easier index search engines, faster navigate, simpler reuse different formats. large organizations public institutions, accessibility also supports transparency compliance.

text: Make sure install verapdf*: *necessary already verapdf cli PATH  Check PDF PDF/UA-1 compliant: works many standards: profile can ua1, ua2, 1a, 1b, 2a, 2b, 2u, 3a, 3b, 3u, 4, 4f, 4e. Default ua1. can find meaning .  Generate HTML accessibility report:  Print accessibility summary important understand difference rules checks. rule failed may “Missing alternative text images”, rule may several checks failed. example, rule “Missing alt text images” occurs 10 times given PDF (e.g., 10 images alternative text), gives us 10 failed checks rule. generally, rule single issue, check corresponds number times rule failed.  Get information stats
code: pdfcheck::install_verapdf() pdfcheck::is_pdf_compliant("report.pdf") #> TRUE  # check for PDF/UA-2 pdfcheck::is_pdf_compliant("report.pdf", profile = "ua2") #> FALSE # Basic usage: this opens your browser pdfcheck::accessibility_report("report.pdf")  # Explicit output file pdfcheck::accessibility_report(    "report.pdf",    output_file = "report.html" )  # Do not open browser pdfcheck::accessibility_report(    "report.pdf",    output_file = "report.html",    open = FALSE )  # Specify a different accessibility standard pdfcheck::accessibility_report(    "report.pdf",    output_file = "report.html",    open = FALSE,    profile = "ua2" ) pdfcheck::accessibility_summary("report.pdf") #> PDF Accessibility Summary #> ========================= #> Verapdf version:  1.28.2 #> Compliant:  No #> Profile:  ua1 #> #> Passed Rules:   95 #> Passed Checks:  591 #> Failed Rules:   11 #> Failed Checks:  195 pdfcheck::verapdf(pdf_file) |>   pdfcheck::get_total_failed_checks() #> 195  pdfcheck::verapdf(pdf_file) |>   pdfcheck::get_total_failed_rules() #> 11  pdfcheck::verapdf(pdf_file) |>   pdfcheck::get_verapdf_version() #> "1.28.2"
